title: Sell Port Ellen Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Port Ellen Whisky | Annual Releases & Independent Bottlings | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your rare Port Ellen whisky. We buy the Diageo Annual Releases (1st-17th) and independent bottlings from this legendary closed Islay distillery.
heroSubhead: Buying Annual Releases and rare independent Port Ellen bottlings.
introParagraph: Port Ellen is the definitive 'Ghost Distillery' of Islay. Closed in 1983, its finite stock is among the most collected whisky in the world.
whatWeDoNotBuy: Bottles with low fill level (below shoulder)
photoChecklist: Front label showing 'Port Ellen' and release details
conditionFactors: Fill Level: Evaporation is the enemy. Mid-neck is good; top-shoulder is borderline; low-shoulder is problem.
Label Condition: Damp cellars can cause mold/staining on labels.
Box: Annual Releases come in specific boxes. Missing box reduces value.
Seal: Check for parafilm damage or cracks.
pricingFactors: Release Number: Early Annual Releases (1st, 2nd, 3rd) are significantly more valuable than later ones.
Bottler: Official bottlings usually command a premium over Independents, though rare DL/G&M are high too.

faqs.question: Do you buy Independent Bottlings?
faqs.answer: Yes! Douglas Laing, Signatory, and G&M Port Ellens are highly desirable.

faqs.question: Which Annual Release is worth the most?
faqs.answer: Generally the 1st Release (2001) is the most expensive due to rarity.

faqs.question: What if the fill level is low?
faqs.answer: We may still buy it, but the price will reflect the 'drinker's risk'. Ideally, it should be in the neck.

faqs.question: Are they reopening?
faqs.answer: Diageo is rebuilding Port Ellen, but the 'New' Port Ellen will be distinct from the 'Old' 1983 stock.

faqs.question: Do you buy Brora too?
faqs.answer: Yes, we buy Brora, Rosebank, and other silent stills.

faqs.question: How do I ship a $3000 bottle?
faqs.answer: Carefully. We recommend double-boxing with plenty of bubble wrap. We provide insurance.
